intro: Varronia scaberrima, commonly known as the roughleaf varroonia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its rough, often hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are followed by small, round fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
